data.name: PlayerMoveSynced
data.value: Player moving values have been synced

data.name: PlayerVoteText
data.value: You are about to vote for the following player

data.name: PositionSelectVote
data.value: Please select a position for this player:

data.name: FAQ1
data.value: What is the Fans All Star Global Vote?

data.name: FAQ2
data.value: Registered participants in the Fans All Star Global Vote 2013 will be able to select their favourite European and Rest of the World squads (two starting elevens plus 4 substitutes on each team making a total of 30 players).

data.name: FAQ4
data.value: A cash prize of £100,000 will be paid to the participant that correctly predicts both the 15-man European squad and the 15-man Rest of the World squad. If more than one participant correctly predicts both squads then one winner will be selected by an independently adjudicated random selection on Monday 1 July 2013. The Cash prize is only available to Adults aged 18+.

data.name: FAQ5
data.value: How many players can I choose from?

data.name: FAQ6
data.value: Participants will select their players from a shortlist of 1,100 players (550 from Europe and 550 from the Rest Of The World) from 275 different clubs, 99 countries and 55 leagues around the world.

data.name: FAQ7
data.value: The 550 players for each squad are made up by 50 goalkeepers, 50 right backs, 50 left backs, 100 centre backs, 200 midfielders and 100 forwards.

data.name: FAQ8
data.value: How are the final squads selected?

data.name: FAQ9
data.value: The final squads of 15 will comprise those players that have received the highest amount of votes in each position.

data.name: FAQ10
data.value: The first eleven for both squads will be:

data.name: FAQ11
data.value: The goalkeeper with the highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ12
data.value: The right back with the highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ13
data.value: The left back with the highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ14
data.value: The two centre backs with the highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ15
data.value: The four midfielders with the highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ16
data.value: The two forwards with the highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ17
data.value: The substitutes for both squads will be:

data.name: FAQ18
data.value: The goalkeeper with the second highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ19
data.value: The centre back with the third highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ20
data.value: The midfielder with the fifth highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ21
data.value: The forward with the third highest amount of votes

data.name: FAQ23
data.value: The formation is set at a standard 4-4-2 only.

data.name: FAQ25
data.value: Voting starts on Wednesday 15 May 2013 and closes on Sunday 30June 2013 at 23.59 GMT.

data.name: FAQ27
data.value: Anyone in the world who has either downloaded the Fans All Star application or registered at www.fansallstar.com.

data.name: FAQ28
data.value: Can I have more than one login?

data.name: FAQ29
data.value: No. Only one login is allowed per participant.

data.name: FAQ30
data.value: How can I register and submit my teams?

data.name: FAQ31
data.value: You can register and vote online at www.fansallstar.com, via the FAS app or Facebook and submit your free European and ROTW teams.

data.name: FAQ32
data.value: How did you select the initial shortlist of 1,100 players?

data.name: FAQ33
data.value: FAS’ team of football specialists have selected 1,100 of the best players from Europe and the Rest of the World.

data.name: FAQ34
data.value: Will any new players be added to this shortlist during the duration of the competition?

data.name: FAQ35
data.value: No players will be added to this shortlist during the competition

data.name: FAQ37
data.value: There are no country, league or team limitations. Voters are free to select any player from the shortlist.

data.name: FAQ38
data.value: How many times can I vote?

data.name: FAQ39
data.value: As a registered participant, you can vote as many times as you wish using your account. The first 30 votes for each registered user are Free and thereafter additional votes are priced in bundles of 30 votes at a cost of circa US$1.00 (one US dollar) for every incremental 30 votes.

data.name: FAQ41
data.value: FAS may display the absolute total number of registered votes but no specific data will be provided for single players.

data.name: FAQ42
data.value: Do I always have to submit one or two full teams?

data.name: FAQ43
data.value: Participants are free to submit one or two teams at a time with no restrictions on the number of total submitted teams.

data.name: FAQ44
data.value: What's the price I pay every time I submit a team?

data.name: FAQ45
data.value: The first two submitted teams (Europe and ROTW) can be submitted for free.

data.name: FAQ46
data.value: How many elimination rounds are there and when will they take place?

data.name: FAQ47
data.value: Two elimination rounds will take place during the competition. The first elimination is scheduled for Sunday 26h May 2013 at 23.59 GMT with the initial shortlist being reduced from 1,100 players to the most voted 660 players (330 Europe and 330 ROTW). The second elimination is scheduled for 16th June 2013 at 23.59 GMT with the shortlist being reduced to the most voted 110 players (55 Europe and 55 ROTW) from 660 players. The final teams selected will be announced in the week commencing on 1st July 2013.

data.name: FAQ48
data.value: If a player is injured, will I need to substitute him on my team?

data.name: FAQ49
data.value: No. The aim of the game is to correctly predict the two squads for Europe and the Rest of the World with the highest votes by position. Being injured does not disqualify a player from being chosen in the final squad.

data.name: FAQ50
data.value: How did you decide the position where a player is allocated if he plays in many different positions for his club?

data.name: FAQ51
data.value: In case of conflict, the FAS team of football experts have selected player positions based on a number of factors including a) most frequent position for his club and b) the player’s favourite position. Current default position for any single player in the 1,100 player shortlist is final and will not be subject to change under any circumstances.

data.name: FAQ52
data.value: What if a Rest of the World player acquires a European nationality or vice versa?

data.name: FAQ53
data.value: Players are assigned a nationality based on the nation they are eligible to represent. In the case of a player with dual nationality and no international caps, he will be assigned his nationality of birth.

data.name: FAQ54
data.value: What online payment system do you use? Is it secure?

data.name: FAQ55
data.value: Any purchase or payment is made through Paypal payment system to ensure the security of your transaction. Visit www.paypal.com for more information.
